1.title: Episode #2.1
1.plot: Woody Allen feels sad for Harvey Weinstein. OJ's back out on the prowl. Black-ish creator Kenya Barris reveals which episode he's proudest of.

2.title: Tuesday, October 17, 2017
2.plot: The Yankees clap back at the Astros. Trump and McConnell pretend to be pals. New Yorkers use literal doggy bags on the subway. A Boogie talks success at a young age.

3.title: Wednesday, October 18, 2017
3.plot: Dwyane Wade calls LeBron cheap and jealous of his hair. The Yankees come back to tie the series at 2. Michael Stahl-David talks Narcos, graffiti and his new films.

4.title: Thursday, October 19, 2017
4.plot: Desus and Mero enjoy game 5 with a white family at Yankee Stadium. A Yelper outs a restaurant for using Popeyes' chicken. Charlamagne Tha God talks "Black Privilege."

5.title: Monday, October 23, 2017
5.plot: Lil B has love for A Boogie's crew after they jump him. Gabrielle Union preaches butt play reciprocity. J.B. Smoove talks "The Book of Leon" and the zombie apocalypse.

6.title: Tuesday, October 24, 2017
6.plot: Bob Corker calls out Trump for all his lies. Ben Carson gets cooked by Rep. Al Green at a HUD budget hearing. Al Harrington talks his new Cannabis film and his NBA days.

7.title: Wednesday, October 25, 2017
7.plot: Amazon wants the key to your house. A dude takes heat for the pics he's liking on Instagram. Talib Kweli talks his new album and his relationships with Chappelle and Kanye.

8.title: Thursday, October 26, 2017
8.plot: Iman Shumpert drops in to watch clips and give some takes. Trump again reminds us how smart he is. Ty Dolla $ign talks about his new album "Beach House 3."

9.title: Monday, October 30, 2017
9.plot: Paul Manafort gets indicted. Cardi B. gets a ring from Offset. Rosie Perez recalls meeting Spike Lee.

10.title: Tuesday, October 31, 2017
10.plot: Trump takes a break from fuming over Mueller to hand out candy to Halloweeners. DeRay Davis talks his Netflix special, roasting comics and polyamory.

11.title: Wednesday, November 1, 2017
11.plot: J.LO and AROD share all their corny details with Vanity Fair. Colin McGregor drops the homophobic F-word again. Frankie J and Baby Bash perform "Suga Suga."

12.title: Thursday, November 2, 2017
12.plot: The CIA shares Bin Laden's movie/porno playlist. Tyrese lets his feelings be known on Facebook, Papa John is mad at the NFL. Gabrielle Union discusses her new book.

13.title: Monday, November 6, 2017
13.plot: Diddy changes his name again. Shaq's beefin with "Big Shaq" from London. Fabolous talks his new collab with Jadakiss and relationship with Jay-Z.

14.title: Tuesday, November 7, 2017
14.plot: Rand Paul gets jumped by his neighbor. A pastor shames a guy and his side chick at a service in Zimbabwe. Jeff Ross talks his new special and life as the roast king.

15.title: Wednesday, November 8, 2017
15.plot: Desus makes Mero eat a McDonald's Filet-O-Fish sandwich. Two lions have sex 100 times in a day. Amanda Seales confronts Mero on his tweets @ her from 2012.

16.title: Thursday, November 9, 2017
16.plot: Drake is stockpiling Birkin bags for future Mrs. Drake. Trump gives China props for taking advantage of the U.S. Steve Stoute talks his success in music and advertising.

17.title: Monday, November 13, 2017
17.plot: Desus and Mero watch 50 shades of Sammy Sosa. Trump meets his favorite dictators in Asia. LeBron rides the subway. T. Pain talks his new album.

18.title: Tuesday, November 14, 2017
18.plot: Enes Kanter gets in LeBron's face. A white guy thinks he's Filipino. A lady finds her man in bed with her mom. Jay Pharoah talks Charlie Murphy and "White Famous."

19.title: Wednesday, November 15, 2017
19.plot: LaVar Ball's boy thanks Trump for freeing him from China. People thinks Blake Shelton is sexy. Gary Owen talks "All Def Comedy" and why black audiences like him.

20.title: Thursday, November 16, 2017
20.plot: A grandpa's heart gets broken on Wheel of Fortune. Articles of Trump's Impeachment get filed in Congress. Erykah Badu talks Soul Train Awards and being a doula.

21.title: Monday, November 20, 2017
21.plot: Trump earns beef status with LaVar Ball, Marshawn Lynch, and Snoop Dogg all in one day. Sneaker Designer John Geiger talks shoes.

22.title: Tuesday, November 21, 2017
22.plot: Chris Cuomo tries to interview LaVar Ball. A rat terrorizes NYC subway riders. Marshawn Lynch loves Mexicans. Diplo talks Rihanna and his new doc.

23.title: Wednesday, November 22, 2017
23.plot: Trump takes Roy Moore's word for it and claps back at LaVar Ball again. Ray Allen gets catfished. Daniel Caesar talks about his new album.

24.title: Thursday, November 23, 2017
24.plot: Desus and Mero host the Ball Baggys: the first annual Thanksgiving awards show that celebrates clips of their favorite people, animals and moments from the past year.

25.title: Monday, November 27, 2017
25.plot: Prince Harry gets engaged. The failing NY Times profiles a Nazi. Cam'Ron and Ma$e have some beef on Thanksgiving. Black Thought talks The Roots and "The Deuce."

26.title: Tuesday, November 28, 2017
26.plot: The Sex Robots are coming. Prince Harry and Meghan Markle discuss their engagement. Wyclef Jean talks his Haitian roots and his new mixtape.

27.title: Wednesday, November 29, 2017
27.plot: Jay-Z's Grammy nomination upsets Laura Ingraham. Eli Manning's benching upsets Mike Francesa. Matty Matheson talks his new show "It's Suppertime."

28.title: Thursday, November 30, 2017
28.plot: Jay-Z gets deep with the failing NY Times. Parliament roasts Trump for retweeting a British anti-Muslim group. Nikole Hannah-Jones talks about why she got into journalism.

29.title: Monday, December 4, 2017
29.plot: Flynn's guilty plea induces an obstruction of justice worthy Trump tweet. Larry King can't handle a vape pen. Ester Dean talks songwriting and "Picture Perfect 3."

30.title: Tuesday, December 5, 2017
30.plot: Desus and Mero celebrate clips of their favorite people, animals and moments from the past year in an awards show appropriately titled "The Ball Baggys."

31.title: Wednesday, December 6, 2017
31.plot: LaVar Ball returns to CNN. Cops bust the most honest meth dealer in America. Wendy Williams throws shade at Ashanti. Big K.R.I.T. talks his new album and upcoming tour.

32.title: Thursday, December 7, 2017
32.plot: Trump slurs his speech on recognizing Jerusalem as the Israeli capital. A soccer fan apologizes for pooping in the stands. Pastor Carl Lentz recalls baptizing Bieber.

34.title: Tuesday, December 12, 2017
34.plot: The mom who filmed her bullied son swears she's not racist. An NYPD precinct releases a bad rap video. Seth Rogen recalls Kanye rapping for him in a van.

35.title: Wednesday, December 13, 2017
35.plot: Lonzo, LaVar and The Lakers take an L at The Garden. Roy Moore takes an L in Alabama. Andy Cohen talks Mariah, J.Lo and his messy show.

36.title: Thursday, December 14, 2017
36.plot: Omarosa is out but denies she got fired. Rodman defends his boo Kim Jong Un. DRAM talks his Christmas EP, his dog and racist telemarketing calls.

37.title: Monday, December 18, 2017
37.plot: Diddy wants to buy the Carolina Panthers. A soccer star paints himself black for a costume party. Jeezy recalls Obama's shout-out and touring with Whiz Khalifa.

38.title: Tuesday, December 19, 2017
38.plot: Trump's struggle to drink water normally during speeches continues. The Cash Me Outside Girl addresses her haters. Jason Sudeikis tries Hennessy and talks "Downsizing."

39.title: Wednesday, December 20, 2017
39.plot: Desus and Mero clap back at internet host DJ Akademiks. A cussing pastor from Memphis gives wild sermons. Bomani Jones talks about his new ESPN show.

40.title: Thursday, December 21, 2017
40.plot: DJ Akademiks keeps the beef with Desus and Mero alive. Mike Pence heaps a load of creepy praise on Trump. Baron Davis talks his new Black Santa Co.& NBA career.

41.title: Tuesday, January 2, 2018
41.plot: CNN's New Year's Eve Live features a weed bus and a drunk Don Lemon. An MMA fighter can't find anyone to fight her. Hari Kondabolu talks "The Problem With Apu."

77.title: Jimmy Fallon
77.plot: Trump fires Rex Tillerson on twitter. The Houston Astros visit the White House. Jimmy Fallon recalls talking pickles with Martha Stewart.

92.title: Matthew Rhys
92.plot: Cardi B. drops her album, reveals that she's pregnant and has mad respect for FDR. Conor McGregor's perpetrator walks in Brooklyn. Matthew Rhys talks final season of The Americans.

1.title: Monday, October 17, 2016
1.plot: In the series premiere the guys dive into discussing the "rigged" election. Later comedian/rapper Awkwafina stops by the studio.

2.title: Tuesday, October 18, 2016
2.plot: Kevin Hart apologizes to prego wife for cheating. Kevin Durant uses fake twitter account to clap back at haters and Joy Bryant talks about being a Supermodel in the 90's.

3.title: Wednesday, October 19, 2016
3.plot: Desus and Mero don't talk about the debate but they do talk about a smoking North Korean chimp. DJ Vashtie Kola stops by.

4.title: Thursday, October 20, 2016
4.plot: Desus and Mero recap the debate low lights, breakdown Kanye's latest rant and Charlamagne Tha God stops by to watch a clip of the first ever hate crime during a game of corn-hole.

5.title: Monday, October 24, 2016
5.plot: Desus and Mero discuss s**t that happened over the weekend and welcome actress Pia Glenn to their graffiti table.

6.title: Tuesday, October 25, 2016
6.plot: Desus and Mero unearth a scandalous clip of Trump being nice, and Fat Jew stops by to watch videos and drink rose.

7.title: Wednesday, October 26, 2016
7.plot: Desus and Mero mock white members of "Blacks for Tump" and mourn the loss of the first Knicks game. Ezra Koenig stops by to see a video of a clown getting pistol whipped.

8.title: Thursday, October 27, 2016
8.plot: Desus & Mero discuss Hillary's gangster wardrobe, Charles Barkley's new TV show and reminisce about the glory days of "Sex and the City."

9.title: Monday, October 31, 2016
9.plot: Desus and Mero welcome Anthony Weiner back into the headlines and shout out the world's largest pit bull. Jillionaire stops by to question the need for Halloween.

10.title: Tuesday, November 1, 2016
10.plot: Desus and Mero judge Lebron's Halloween party and Jay and Bey's costumes. But the scariest part of last night was Tump leading the polls by one point.

11.title: Wednesday, November 2, 2016
11.plot: Desus & Mero beg their fans to stop tweeting that the Knicks suck. Rembert Browne stops by to reminisce about his flight on Air Force 1.

12.title: Thursday, November 3, 2016
12.plot: Desus and Mero discuss the World Champion Chicago Cubs' disgusting dugout celebration, Kenny Chesney's disgusting snub of Beyonce and Johnny Damon's disgusting support of Trump.

13.title: Monday, November 7, 2016
13.plot: Desus and Mero endorse Jay Z's endorsement of Hillary and Putin's love of bears. Former White House Deputy Chief of Staff Alyssa Mastromonaco stops by to talk about what life with Barry is like.

14.title: LIVE Election Special 2016
14.plot: Desus and Mero usher in the end of our national nightmare live. With special in-studio guests Talib Kweli, Cardi B and Jim Jones. Plus political commentary from Joe Budden, Ezra Koenig, Charlamagne Tha God and The Fat Jew.

15.title: Wednesday, November 9, 2016
15.plot: Desus and Mero nurse their election hangover by continuing to talk about the election. DeRay McKesson stops by to talk election aftermath and his activism.

16.title: Thursday, November 10, 2016
16.plot: Desus and Mero talk the awkward Trump/Obama meet and greet, the awful Paul McCartney Mannequin Challenge and Mero's wife surprises him with a phone call.

17.title: Monday, November 14, 2016
17.plot: Desus and Mero welcome white nationalism to the White House and listen to Yoko Ono's screaming tribute to President-elect Trump. Bomani Jones stops by to discuss The Root 100 list.

18.title: Tuesday, November 15, 2016
18.plot: Desus and Mero discuss Barry's dig on Hillary and New Balance's unwanted endorsement deal. Nick Catchdubs stops by to talk about 50 Cents' rainmaking skills.

19.title: Wednesday, November 16, 2016
19.plot: Desus and Mero look forward to Trump's reality show presidency. Adult film star Janice Griffin stops by to talk racism in porn and adult stocking stuffers.

20.title: Thursday, November 17, 2016
20.plot: Desus and Mero discuss Drake's staged crush. Cord Jefferson stops by to play a game of where in the world was Cord Jefferson.

21.title: Monday, November 21, 2016
21.plot: Desus and Mero finally see some good in Hamilton the Musical and shout out yoga goats. NY Times Food editor Sam Sifton stops by to talk about chopped cheese appropriations.

22.title: Tuesday, November 22, 2016
22.plot: Desus and Mero salute the alt-right for not being as bad as actual Nazis and impersonate DMX. Special guest Rashida Jones stops by to show us her monkey bite scar.

23.title: Wednesday, November 23, 2016
23.plot: Desus and Mero prepare for Thanksgiving with blogger KFC from Barstool Sports.

24.title: Thursday, November 24, 2016
24.plot: Desus and Mero celebrate Thanksgiving by giving thanks for their favorite moments from past episodes of Desus and Mero.

25.title: Monday, November 28, 2016
25.plot: Desus and Mero discuss Colin Kaepernick's foray into controversial t-shirt wearing. Artist Tony Peralta stops by to talk Washington Heights gentrification.

26.title: Tuesday, November 29, 2016
26.plot: Desus and Mero say some problematic $#!%. Columnist Michael Arceneaux joins them.

27.title: Wednesday, November 30, 2016
27.plot: Desus and Mero discuss what Mitt Romney ate besides his pride during dinner with Donald Trump. Chris Hayes stops by to talk growing up in the Bronx.

28.title: Thursday, December 1, 2016
28.plot: Desus and Mero discuss Melo's last second shot and Obama's last minute weed endorsement. Model Amina Blue stops by to talk about music video life.

29.title: Monday, December 5, 2016
29.plot: Desus and Mero congratulate Ben Carson for getting the job he said he's unqualified for. Cultural critic and writer Jamilah Lemieux discusses misconceptions about black activist groups.

30.title: Tuesday, December 6, 2016
30.plot: Desus and Mero take credit for Klay Thompson's 60 point explosion. Knicks Superfan The Loopy Blogger stops by to talk about who he has beefs with and why he's a Dallas Cowboys fan.

31.title: Wednesday, December 7, 2016
31.plot: Desus and Mero make plans to spend Mother's Day with Derek Jeter. Legendary hip hop group The Lox stop by to talk about coming up and staying there.

32.title: Thursday, December 8, 2016
32.plot: Desus watches Mero destroy the Apple Crush challenge. ESPN 's Pablo Torre stops by to name drop Mark Zuckerberg's wife and to teach us the New York way to kill a mouse.

33.title: Monday, December 12, 2016
33.plot: Desus and Mero join Trump in questioning his intelligence. Immortal Technique sits down to talk about that time he made Lin-Manuel Miranda sing in a garbage can.

34.title: Tuesday, December 13, 2016
34.plot: Desus and Mero discuss Kanye's strangest move to date: meeting with Trump. Nick Cannon stops by to dish on why he wasn't invited to his kids' playdate with Beyonce.

35.title: Wednesday, December 14, 2016
35.plot: Desus and Mero debate whether or not you should mouth kiss your kids. Willie Geist stops by to talk about interviewing Mick Jagger.

36.title: Thursday, December 15, 2016
36.plot: Mero pleads with Chrissy Teigen to follow him on Twitter again while Desus loses his shit. Comedian Franchesca Ramsey tells us why you should never make white girls cry.

37.title: Monday, December 19, 2016
37.plot: Desus compliments Mero for his "butt expertise." Garbage Time's Katie Nolan stops by to audition for the newly open position in Fifth Harmony.

38.title: Tuesday, December 20, 2016
38.plot: Desus and Mero shout-out the security guard who was way too excited to see the San Diego Chargers Cheerleaders. John Hodgman sits down to throw some shade at the Verizon guy.

39.title: Wednesday, December 21, 2016
39.plot: Desus and Mero watch videos that make them never want to book Delta flights to Kentucky. Angie Martinez stops by to try her best to make the guys cry.

40.title: Thursday, December 22, 2016
40.plot: On their last show of 2016, Desus and Mero celebrate the holidays by braving the cold and bros of Santacon.

41.title: Monday, January 9, 2017
41.plot: Desus & Mero kick off the new year by watching a video of a guy not getting shot for calling a cop a dickhead. Abdullah Saeed stops by to teach the guys how to smoke weed out of a bear's ass.

42.title: Tuesday, January 10, 2017
42.plot: Desus reminds Mero that Jeff Sessions is the guy who sees no value in Dominican immigrants. Financial advisor Josh Brown stops by to give some money tips.

43.title: Wednesday, January 11, 2017
43.plot: Desus and Mero discuss Barry's powerful farewell speech. NY Times Critic Wesley Morris stops by to talk about the one door his Pulitzer prize has yet to open for him.

44.title: Thursday, January 12, 2017
44.plot: Desus and Mero cancel their L.L. Bean catalog subscription as they mourn the death of a robot monkey. NY Times writer Jenna Wortham talks about turning down an offer.

45.title: Monday, January 16, 2017
45.plot: Desus and Mero celebrate MLK day with recording artist Jean Grae.

46.title: Tuesday, January 17, 2017
46.plot: Desus somehow gets Mero REALLY fired up about Ray Romano. Comedian Neal Brennan talks about his Netflix special, public bathrooms and "The Pullout Gang."

47.title: Wednesday, January 18, 2017
47.plot: Desus and Mero debate Nelly vs Drake but agree there's definitely a Trump pee tape. Melissa Harris-Perry discusses tampon earrings and the time she saw Obama at Walgreens.

48.title: Thursday, January 19, 2017
48.plot: Desus asks UFC's Amanda Nunes to give Mero some tips for kicking Ray Romano's ass. Jamali Maddix talks about meeting racists & the calming effect of saying "White Devil."

49.title: Monday, January 23, 2017
49.plot: Desus & Mero share some alternative facts and play a game of "F*ck Up a Nazi." "Another Round" podcast hosts Heben and Tracy talk women's march and b-hole bleaching.

50.title: Tuesday, January 24, 2017
50.plot: Soledad O'Brien pleads with the media to stop normalizing white supremacy. Desus & Mero plead with their male viewers to get tested for HPV.

51.title: Wednesday, January 25, 2017
51.plot: Desus and Mero watch Sean Spicer stutter through a press conference and Kellyanne bomb at stand-up. Joe Budden talks Trump's wall and invites the guys to his pool party.

52.title: Thursday, January 26, 2017
52.plot: Donald Trump is still talking about the size of his inauguration crowd and Sean Spicer is still tweeting with his butt cheeks. Stevie J tells a Biggie story for the ages.

53.title: Episode #1.53
53.plot: Desus and Mero discuss Trump's fears of Muslims and staircases. CC Sabathia talks about throwing 147 pitches in a game and eating two boxes of Cap'n Crunch in one sitting.

54.title: Episode #1.54
54.plot: Desus and Mero watch some chimps eat their dead leader's genitals. Former Black Panther Jamal Joseph talks about his memoir and his new film, "Chapter and Verse."

55.title: Episode #1.55
55.plot: Desus and Mero dive into Donald Trump's Black History Month "listening session", wonder what Obama's vacation is looking like, and examine Drake's appearance on Nicki Minaj's Instagram.

56.title: Episode #1.56
56.plot: Beyonce is having twins, Donald is praying for Arnold and Desus and Mero are fighting a Ray Romano pillow. Jemele Hill talks sports, politics, and Beyonce's twins.

57.title: Episode #1.57
57.plot: Desus and Mero recap the Super Bowl and blame the Russians for the Patriots' win. Fat Joe talks about his love of the Bronx and how giant birds made him sell his dream house.

58.title: Episode #1.58
58.plot: Desus and Mero check out Barry's vacay pics and watch a cockroach get removed from a girl's skull. BMX rider Nigel Sylvester does the first and last bike trick on set.

59.title: Episode #1.59
59.plot: Desus and Mero show us what Mitch McConnell and George Lopez have in common. Hot 97's Nessa joins the debate on mouth kissing your kids and talks vegan farts.

60.title: Episode #1.60
60.plot: Desus and Mero trash Ivanka Trump's shoes, freestyle rap Coretta Scott King's name and pay Charles Oakley the respects that the Knicks refuse to.

61.title: Episode #1.61
61.plot: Desus and Mero compares Adele's Grammy speech to a typical ending of a Knicks game. Yandy Smith recalls working for Jim Jones when "Ballin" dropped.

62.title: Episode #1.62
62.plot: Desus and Mero spend Valentine's Day talking about Trump and Flynn's breakup, Ivanka's Trudeau crush and gorilla sex. Mr. Vegas proves he can still hit the high notes.

63.title: Episode #1.63
63.plot: Desus and Mero read angry Trump tweets and a sad Future Instagram. Rachel Maddow discusses how fiction is a better source than history in contextualizing today's news.

64.title: Episode #1.64
64.plot: Desus and Mero get just as confused as you did by Donald Trump's bizarre press conference. David East tells us why he was afraid to drive Kevin Durant's Maybach.

65.title: Episode #1.65
65.plot: Desus and Mero recap the Oscars and breakdown Remy Ma's latest dis on Nicki Manaj. Activist Johnetta Elzie talks about getting tear gassed in Ferguson and Campaign Zero.

66.title: Episode #1.66
66.plot: Desus and Mero tell Kellyanne to get her damn feet off the damn couch. Comedian Damien Lemon tells us how to handle hecklers.

67.title: Episode #1.67
67.plot: Desus and Mero breakdown Trump's joint session in DC and Sessions' threat to joints everywhere. Don Q warns that his crew might steal your girl at his show.

68.title: Episode #1.68
68.plot: Jeff Sessions gets exposed for being the liar Desus and Mero have been telling you he is. Flatbush Zombies talk about guilty purchases and psychedelics.

69.title: Episode #1.69
69.plot: Desus and Mero discuss the pros but mostly the cons of the "smart condom." Eddie Huang tells his Mongolian airport bathroom disaster story.

70.title: Episode #1.70
70.plot: Ben Carson redefines slavery, Trump literally stands in Hill's shadow and Mero juggles fruit for Desus. Ebro stops by to discuss his role in the Nicki/Remy beef.

71.title: Episode #1.71
71.plot: Desus and Mero play some of Donald Trump's greatest hits on women. Crissle West tells us how she plans to celebrate International Women's Day.

72.title: Episode #1.72
72.plot: Desus and Mero celebrate the union of Bronx royalty J-Lo and A-Rod. Joey Bada$$ discusses acting, music and what the secret service asked him not to do.

73.title: Episode #1.73
73.plot: Desus and Mero remind Congressman Steve King that Iowa was not part of the confederacy. Faith Evans discusses her new album and Biggie's legacy.

74.title: Episode #1.74
74.plot: Breitbart and the CBO snitch on Paul Ryan and Sam Jackson tells black British actors to Get Out. Guest Michael Arceneaux is on team Nicki and dreams of being gay Future.

75.title: Episode #1.75
75.plot: Desus and Mero breakdown the Maddow letdown and the greatest Bronx video ever. NFL player Jared Odrick talks locker room fights and Toradol Tuesdays.

76.title: Episode #1.76
76.plot: Trump is 0 for 2 on racist travel bans but batting .1000 in "Lock Her Up" chants at rallies. Jesse Williams talks ebrojis, his favorite job and not being an actual Dr.

77.title: Episode #1.77
77.plot: Drake drops his new album, Comey testifies and Desus and Mero remind the world that Tim Allen's a snitch. Chris Hayes talks about his new book and his 3-yr-old's Trump impression.

78.title: Episode #1.78
78.plot: In a strange twist, Desus and Mero talk Trump's golfing and Tiger Woods' hair. VICE World of Sports host Sal Masekela recalls getting high with Method Man and DMX.

79.title: Episode #1.79
79.plot: Desus and Mero pay tribute to former shitty candidate and current shitty comedian Mike Huckabee. Young M.A talks about her drunken Jamaican show the online obsession with her strap.

80.title: Episode #1.80
80.plot: Desus and Mero imagine what it would be like to party with Trump in Russia. Michael Skolnik recalls the time Trump told him he'd run for president in 2012.

81.title: Episode #1.81
81.plot: Trump helps Desus and Mero discover their new least favorite Fox News host. Mike Will Made-It recalls the time Chief Keef hung up on him.

82.title: Episode #1.82
82.plot: Desus and Mero tell Rachel Dolezal and Bill O'Reilly to stay out of black peoples' hair. Run The Jewels talk about the moment they knew their solo days were done.

83.title: Episode #1.83
83.plot: Desus and Mero tell Maxine Waters and April Ryan they got their backs. Arian Foster discusses his retirement from the NFL and fighting wolves to the death.

84.title: Episode #1.84
84.plot: Desus and Mero theorize why Mike Pence really calls his wife "Mother." Juelz Santana recalls waking up Cam'ron to meet him and bar fighting with Jim Jones.

85.title: Episode #1.85
85.plot: Desus and Mero discuss Bill O'Reilly's harassment suits, thank Jerry Jones for finally being pro-weed and watch a video of a grandma literally getting shit-faced.

86.title: Episode #1.86
86.plot: Trump voters worry they'll end up on the wrong side of the wall they voted for. Hari Kondabolu recalls interning for Hillary Clinton and saying no to Chris Rock.

87.title: Episode #1.87
87.plot: Desus and Mero help Pepsi understand what they got wrong in their new ad. Guest Angela Rye addresses her epic beatdown on Joe Walsh.

88.title: Episode #1.88
88.plot: Trump changes his tune on Syria and Maxine Waters wants O'Reilly in jail. Guest Mack Wilds talks about his new album and how he got on Adele's video for "Hello."

89.title: Episode #1.89
89.plot: Desus and Mero travel to LA for Weed Week. Jerrod Carmichael talks about his idea for a new Titanic movie, meeting Petey Pablo and having no fond memories of being poor.

90.title: Episode #1.90
90.plot: Lala makes Melo a free agent and Trump casually hopes to avoid nuclear war. Anthony Anderson talks about going back to college and why he had to hire his mother.

91.title: Episode #1.91
91.plot: The Patriots meet Trump without Brady and O'Reilly meets the Pope without a job. Aubrey Plaza stops by to FaceTime Chelsea Peretti for baby gift ideas.

92.title: Episode #1.92
92.plot: Desus and Mero celebrate 420 by debating who the hottest white male celebrity is. Shane Smith talks about his Picasso plate and being banned from North Korea.

93.title: Episode #1.93
93.plot: Obama speaks to Chicago youth about leadership while our nation's leader sends a flurry of angry tweets from his toilet. A$AP Ferg talks fashion and Timb etiquette.

94.title: Episode #1.94
94.plot: Shea Moisture and FaceApp compete to see which company can offend the most people of color. Jay Williams tells us why he would never gamble with Michael Jordan.

95.title: Episode #1.95
95.plot: Fox News is an equal opportunity discriminator and their boy Jesse Watters defends Ivanka by making a dick joke. Rick Ross talks healthy eating and makes it rain watermelons.

96.title: Episode #1.96
96.plot: Trump releases his tax plan on what appears to be a dinner napkin. Chad Johnson talks about his FIFA dominance and encourages Desus to make a baby.

97.title: Episode #1.97
97.plot: Fyre Festival was neither fire nor festive and Trump thinks the Civil War was just a big misunderstanding. Neil deGrasse Tyson discusses his new book and movie plot holes.

98.title: Episode #1.98
98.plot: It's racist bobblehead night at Fenway while Lala shades Melo at the Met Gala. The Lucas Bros. discuss their Netflix special and their Jermaine Jackson obsession.

99.title: Episode #1.99
99.plot: Hillary emerges with some tweet inducing shade for Trump while Jeter and A-Rod bond during a terrible interview. Paul Scheer gives the guys shit for shopping at Erewhon.

100.title: Episode #1.100
100.plot: To celebrate the 100th episode of Desus and Mero, Morning Joe and Mika get engaged and Tom Colicchio joins the guys for a Chopped Cheese taste test.

101.title: Episode #1.101
101.plot: Charles Barkley tries to end racism with a TV show while a racist Trader Joe's shopper earns her 15 minutes the hard way. Krishna Andavolu talks about driving stoned.

102.title: Episode #1.102
102.plot: Sally Yates fact slaps Ted Cruz and Spirit takes bad airline PR to the next level. Shad Moss recalls the time Michael Jordan threw out his sneakers.

103.title: Episode #1.103
103.plot: Comey gets fired by Trump and Bow Bow gets busted by the internet. Timothy Simons discusses how it sometimes feel like team Trump is parodying Veep.

104.title: Episode #1.104
104.plot: Macron's wife is his former classmate's hot mom and Trump says things he shouldn't have to Lester Holt. Cipha Sounds recalls the time Jay Z wouldn't give him his number.

105.title: Episode #1.105
105.plot: Kellyanne Conway might be as miserable in her job as we hope she is. Al Sharpton recalls what he told Obama in '04 and what he told Trump in '17.

106.title: Episode #1.106
106.plot: Trump leaks all over some Russians again and his McMaster tries to clean up the mess. Cari Champion explains why thigh meat and journalism mesh.

107.title: Episode #1.107
107.plot: Putin and Comey both offer to share their notes on Trump's sketchy Oval Office conversations. Whoopi Goldberg discusses fame, the Knicks and her cannabis product for women.

108.title: Episode #1.108
108.plot: Trump cries witch hunt, Ryan learns that tape recorders aren't loyal and there's a Japanese porn star who looks criminally young. Melissa Harris-Perry returns.

109.title: Episode #1.109
109.plot: Trump takes his talents to the Middle East for some sword dancing, orb grabbing, and First Lady irritating. NBA'er Enes Kanter explains why Turkey revoked his passport.

110.title: Episode #1.110
110.plot: Desus and Mero run with a twitter rumor that Melania wants out and marvel at a clip of two bees having sex. Hannibal Buress talks Baywatch and "vague fame."

111.title: Episode #1.111
111.plot: Trump meets the pope, Shaq and Barkley go at it and Ellen grills Nicki Minaj about Nas. Rob Huebel explains why he's banned from Yankee Stadium.

112.title: Episode #1.112
112.plot: Trump finally gets to piss off NATO in person and former brain surgeon Ben Carson thinks poverty is a mindset. Larry Wilmore tells us which of his shows he's most proud of.

113.title: Episode #1.113
113.plot: Bill Maher drops the N word on his show and Megyn Kelly fails to get Putin to confess on hers. Malcolm Gladwell explains why you shouldn't want your kids to be geniuses.

114.title: Episode #1.114
114.plot: Eric and Donald Tump Jr. defend their dad, their business, and their sister. Joy Reid recalls the craziest story she ever covered as a reporter in Florida.

115.title: Episode #1.115
115.plot: Trump's intelligence team won't snitch to the Senate and Seinfeld won't give Ke$ha a hug. Sasheer Zamata lists all the other comics she gets confused for.

116.title: Episode #1.116
116.plot: Comey calls Trump a liar under oath, McCain forgets which hearing he's at and more bee sex. Ron Funches breaks down his weed intake and his beef with LeBron.

117.title: Episode #1.117
117.plot: Melania moves to DC, Barkley goes to fat camp and there's finally a hair tattoo for bald people. Freddie Gibbs talks about being falsely accused and jailed in Austria.

118.title: Episode #1.118
118.plot: Trump's cabinet heaps staged praise on their leader, Durant gets his ring and Rodman goes back to North Korea to see his boo. Big Boi unblocks Desus on Twitter.

119.title: Episode #1.119
119.plot: Sessions testifies that he has a bad memory and that black women make him nervous. Lizzo talks about performing at Sam Bee's party for Hillary on election night.

120.title: Episode #1.120
120.plot: For his birthday, Trump gets an investigation from the FBI and some serious clowning from the Australian PM. French Montana talks his new single and his bowling game.

121.title: Episode #1.121
121.plot: Trump's lawyer confirms and denies he's under investigation, Jay Z teases his new song and a man messes with the wrong pig. Baron Ambrosia recalls swimming the Bronx River.

122.title: Episode #1.122
122.plot: Desus and Mero bid a fond, "just in case" farewell to the Spiceman. Casanova 2X recalls the advice he got from Taxstone and the time he met Jay Z.

123.title: Episode #1.123
123.plot: A pro golfer tries to end racism with some tweets and Reverend Al shows off his freakish strength. James Davis talks hanging with Kevin Hart and growing up Hood Adjacent.

124.title: Episode #1.124
124.plot: Trump admits he didn't tape Comey and Phil Jackson admits he might ruin the Knicks. Matt Walsh talks living in the apocalypse and refrigerated dog food.

125.title: Episode #1.125
125.plot: Joe Budden's got no time for Migos and Trump's blaming Obama for his Russian drama. Bert Kreischer recalls the time Will Smith took him to the movies.

126.title: Episode #1.126
126.plot: Drake hosts the NBA Awards and LaVar Ball takes his act to the WWE. Janet Mock talks about her new book and hanging with Oprah.

127.title: Episode #1.127
127.plot: The Knicks are free at last from Phil, Melo reunites with Lala and Trump hits on a reporter in the Oval Office. Von Miller talks celebration dances and chicken farming.

128.title: Episode #1.128
128.plot: Mika Brzezinski gets so deep under Trump's skin that he angrily tweets about hers. Diddy talks about his career and his new documentary "Cant' Stop Won't Stop."

129.title: Episode #1.129
129.plot: Conor McGregor makes a racial joke to prove he isn't racist. Eagles Safety Malcolm Jenkins discusses his criminal justice reform activism.

130.title: Episode #1.130
130.plot: Michael Vick offers terrible advice to Colin Kaepernick and Trumpcare dies on the table. Issa Rae talks season 2 of Insecure and #TeamIssa.

131.title: Episode #1.131
131.plot: Trump Jr. wants this nightmare to end as bad as we do. Action Bronson talks F*ck That's Delicious and his new album "Blue Chips 7000."

132.title: Episode #1.132
132.plot: O.J. takes his talents to the parole board, Trump talks to the failing NY Times and a raccoon takes a hydrant bath in the BX. Matteo Lane talks Grindr and dating in Italy.

133.title: Episode #1.133
133.plot: "The Mooch" picks up the Spiceman's mic and Kushner kicks off his "no collusion" tour. A-Trak talks Fool's Gold and touring with Kanye.

134.title: Episode #1.134
134.plot: Trump takes some Boy Scouts to the swamp and Stephen A. spills more tea on Lebron and Kyrie. Spike Jonze talks Frank Ocean and the one prank they couldn't air on Jackass.

135.title: Episode #1.135
135.plot: Trump bans trans people from serving in the military he dodged. Vic Mensa talks about his 30-foot fall, tagging in Chicago and his new album "Autobiography."

136.title: Episode #1.136
136.plot: Bieber has Jesus fever, The BBC gets a whiff of The Mooch and we got dancing grannies. Jessica Williams talks hanging with J.K. Rowling, Panda Express and her new film.

137.title: Episode #1.137
137.plot: Steph clowns Lebron, Mrs. Mooch files for divorce and Chris Christie confronts another angry sports fan. Irv Gotti talks "Tales", J-Lo and 50 Cent.

138.title: Episode #1.138
138.plot: Down goes The Mooch, Trump's got police brutality jokes and another demon goat video surfaces. DeRay McKesson talks RompHims, Kaepernick and mending fences with Whoopie.

139.title: Episode #1.139
139.plot: MJ gives LaVar Ball some fatherly advice and J-Lo and A-Rod take a joy ride. Liza Treyger talks shutting down hecklers and meeting Steve-O.

140.title: Episode #1.140
140.plot: Stephen Miller brings his alt right charm to the WH press corps and Ray Lewis offers more confusing advice to Kaepernick. Jay Ellis talks nude scenes and Insecure's rise.

141.title: Monday, August 7, 2017
141.plot: Trump vacations in New Jersey, Putin fishes topless and Jon Jones chokes out Mero. James Van Der Beek talks playing Diplo and being the original meme.

142.title: Tuesday, August 8, 2017
142.plot: Trump's base shrinks and Boosie BadAzz posts a helluva birthday message to his young son. Yvonne Orji talks Insecure, meeting Obama and touring with Chris Rock.

143.title: Wednesday, August 9, 2017
143.plot: Trump sees Kim Jong Un's crazy and raises him "Fire and Fury", Manafort gets raided and Usher burns his accuser. DJ Clue talks DJ'ing for The Mooch and meeting Michael Jackson.

144.title: Thursday, August 10, 2017
144.plot: European leaders throw shade at Trump while God okays him nuking North Korea. Max Kellerman talks McGregor vs Mayweather and Lebron vs Jordan.

145.title: Monday, August 14, 2017
145.plot: Nazis send their worst and whitest to Virginia. Joe Mande talks his Netflix special, getting voicemails from Fabolous and tweeting dick pics to Mitch McConnell.

146.title: Tuesday, August 15, 2017
146.plot: A CNN panel erupts, a Confederate statue falls and Kim K. fails to get her fans to forgive Jeffree Star's racism. Seth Meyers talks Charlottesville, SNL and roasting Trump.

147.title: Wednesday, August 16, 2017
147.plot: Trump tries to convince America that not all Nazis are bad. Rep. Adriano Espaillat explains why he wanted to go to DC and gets introduced to "I no f@*#ing baby."

148.title: Thursday, August 17, 2017
148.plot: A Nazi cries for help and a CA teacher fights to make Nazi punching legal. Angela Rye talks her new podcast, Omarosa and the CNN cafeteria.

149.title: Monday, August 21, 2017
149.plot: Trump stares down the eclipse and the NYPD raises "Blue Racism" awareness. Rachel Nichols explains why athletes shouldn't stick to sports.

150.title: Tuesday, August 22, 2017
150.plot: Tucker Carlson praises Trump for staring at the sun and a woman explains how you can get pregnant through the back door. Zane Lowe talks Kanye's impact on his career.

151.title: Wednesday, August 23, 2017
151.plot: Trump rambles to his base for 77 minutes at a rally in Phoenix. Russell Peters talks fighting bullies and almost getting to make out with Sofia Vergara.

152.title: Thursday, August 24, 2017
152.plot: James Clapper frets over Trump having nuke codes, a black man marches for the Confederacy and a dog uses a urinal. Esperanza Spalding recalls jamming with Prince.

153.title: Monday, August 28, 2017
153.plot: Mayweather KOs McGregor, Cardi B. wants Offset to propose and Trump appears to brag about his hurricane size. Rashad Jennings talks dancing, poetry and saving money.

154.title: Tuesday, August 29, 2017
154.plot: Trump visits Texas to offer its governor his support and an awkward handshake. The failing NY Times has new dirt on his ties to Russia. Bam Margera discusses his wild past.

155.title: Wednesday, August 30, 2017
155.plot: Joel Osteen responds to his twitter shamers and Trump admires the turnout for his hurricane rally. Aminé talks about his new album, Portland and meeting Malia Obama.

156.title: Thursday, August 31, 2017
156.plot: Master P. has words for Kevin Hart, Jamie Foxx does a mean Stephen A. and Aaron Rodgers kinda has Kaepernick's back. Jermaine Fowler talks family and "Superior Donuts."

157.title: Monday, September 11, 2017
157.plot: Steve Bannon flexes his jowls on 60 minutes and Jim Carrey stops by Fashion Week to trash it. Danny McBride and Walton Goggins talk Vice Principals.

158.title: Tuesday, September 12, 2017
158.plot: Ted Cruz gets caught liking porn, Sergio Dipp takes bad sideline reporting to the next level and I No Fucking Baby lights up at a traffic stop. Jerry Ferrara talks "Power."

159.title: Wednesday, September 13, 2017
159.plot: Jemele Hill's Trump tweets upset racist Twitter and Jason Whitlock. Iman Shumpert recalls shooting Kanye's Fade video with his wife.

160.title: Thursday, September 14, 2017
160.plot: Schumer, Pelosi and Trump cut a DACA deal over Chinese food and Sarah Huckabee Sanders wants Jemele Hill fired. A$AP Twellvyy talks growing up in The BX.

161.title: Monday, September 18, 2017
161.plot: Kevin Hart apologizes to prego wife for cheating. Kevin Durant uses fake twitter account to clap back at haters and Joy Bryant talks about being a Supermodel in the 90's.

162.title: Tuesday, September 19, 2017
162.plot: Trump threatens the "Rocket Man" at the UN. A mad pooper is on the loose in Colorado. Andra Day talks about her activism and being mentored by Stevie Wonder.

163.title: Wednesday, September 20, 2017
163.plot: Russia plays war games at NATO's doorstep. PETA runs up on Gucci Mane. A rhino can't get it up. Adrian Grenier talks about his #stopsucking campaign.

164.title: Thursday, September 21, 2017
164.plot: Trump meets African leaders and shouts out a country that doesn't exist. Jimmy Kimmel claps back at Fox and Friends. Victor Oladipo talks about his music and his game.

imdb.title: Desus & Mero
plot: The Bronx's very own Desus Nice and The Kid Mero, aka the Bodega Boys, give you their takes on politics, sports, entertainment, and other subjects they don't really know about.
